programme.title: Main Events - Easter Jr v Cruz
programme.desc: February 2017. Unbeaten Lightweight Champion Robert Easter returns home to defend his title vs Puerto Rican contender Luis Cruz.(n)

programme.title: Main Events - Horn v Crawford
programme.desc: June 2018. One of the very best fighters on the planet, Terence Crawford, is aiming to win his first World Title at Welterweight as he takes on Manny Pacquiao conqueror Jeff Horn.(n)

programme.title: Main Events - Linares v Lomachenko
programme.desc: May 2018. Ukrainian star Vasily Lomachenko moves up to the 135-pound weight division as he looks to become a three-weight World Champion against Venezuelan hotshot Jorge Linares.(n)

programme.title: Uncut: Lomachenko v Pedraza
programme.desc: WBA Lightweight and Ring Magazine Champion Vasyl Lomachenko clashes with Puerto Rican WBO titlist Jose Pedraza in a bid to unify World Titles for the first time. The whole night, uncut.(n)

programme.title: Boxing Matters Special

programme.title: Main Events - Magdaleno v Dogboe
programme.desc: April 2018. Rising World Super Bantamweight Champion Jessie Magdaleno defends his WBO belt against Ghana's Isaac Dogboe.(n)

programme.title: Main Events - Matthysse v Pacquiao
programme.desc: September 2018. Following his shock defeat to Australian ace Jeff Horn, Manny Pacquiao steps up to face Argentine knockout sensation Lucas Matthysse for his WBA World Welterweight Title.(n)

programme.title: Main Events - Matthysse v Kiram
programme.desc: January 2018. Lucas Matthysse takes on Tewa Kiram for the vacant WBA Welterweight World Tile.(n)

programme.title: Uncut: Crawford v Benavidez

programme.title: Uncut: Flanagan v Zepeda
programme.desc: 10 years after seeing his hero Ricky Hatton win the IBF belt against Kostya Tszyu, Terry 'Turbo' Flanagan has his chance to become world champion in his hometown of Manchester. The whole night Uncut.(n)

programme.title: Fight To Remember Swain v Brodie
programme.desc: We go back to 1997 as Wales' Neil Swain travelled to Manchester to take on local rising star Michael Brodie for the vacant British Super-Bantamweight title.(n)

programme.title: Boxing Matters Top 10 British Lightweights

programme.title: Uncut: Beltran v Moses

programme.title: Main Events - Broner v Granados
programme.desc: Talented four-weight World Champion Adrien Broner fights Adrian Granados. Broner held World Titles in the Super-Feather, Lightweight, Super-Light and Welterweight divisions and now wants a 140lbs belt.(n)

programme.title: Main Events - Thurman v Garcia

programme.desc: An interview with former two-time world heavyweight champion Larry Holmes, whose professional career began in 1973 and ended in 2002. programme.title: Fight Night
programme.sub-title: George Groves v Andrea Di Luisa
programme.desc: George Groves v Andrea Di Luisa. Another chance to see the bout for the vacant WBC International Super Middleweight title at the Copper Box in London. Home favourite Groves will have been hoping to bounce back immediately following his split-decision loss to Badou Jack for the WBC World title, which took place in September on the undercard of Floyd Mayweather Jr v Andre Berto in Las Vegas. A convincing win over Italian opponent Di Luisa would put Groves back on track for a fourth world title shot - potentially versus his old foe James DeGale, who holds the IBF belt.(n)

programme.desc: Bradford City v Northampton Town. Action from the 2012/13 League Two play-off final at Wembley Stadium, where promotion to League One awaited the winners. The Bantams were making their second appearance of the season at Wembley having also reached the League Cup final following an outstanding giant-killing run, and they needed to come from behind to edge out Burton Albion to reach this stage.
